title: Social Networking with Aptosphere
description: Explore Aptosphere, an innovative on-chain social protocol built on Aptos that enables decentralized social networking features like profiles, posts, follows, and interactions all secured by blockchain technology.

tasks.title: Prepare for Social Engagement
tasks.description: Add at least 0.05 APT to your wallet to begin exploring Aptosphere

tasks.title: Decentralized Social Basics
tasks.description: Understand what on-chain social networking is
tasks.question: What is a decentralized social protocol like Aptosphere?
options: A traditional social network like Facebook
A protocol that enables social interactions to be recorded on a blockchain with user ownership of data
A private messaging app
A content subscription service
tasks.correctAnswer: A protocol that enables social interactions to be recorded on a blockchain with user ownership of data

tasks.title: User Profiles
tasks.question: How are user profiles typically handled in Aptosphere?
options: They are stored on centralized servers
They are represented as on-chain resources owned by the user's wallet
They can only be created by administrators
They don't exist - only anonymous posting is allowed
tasks.correctAnswer: They are represented as on-chain resources owned by the user's wallet

tasks.title: Content Creation
tasks.question: How is content typically created and stored on Aptosphere?
options: Content is only stored off-chain
Content is created through on-chain transactions and stored as resources
Content can only be created by the platform owners
Content is stored on traditional web servers unrelated to blockchain
tasks.correctAnswer: Content is created through on-chain transactions and stored as resources

tasks.title: Social Interactions
tasks.description: Learn about engaging with other users
tasks.question: What types of social interactions might Aptosphere support?
options: Only posting content
Only private messages
Following users, liking, commenting, and reposting content
Only anonymous voting
tasks.correctAnswer: Following users, liking, commenting, and reposting content

tasks.title: Content Ownership
tasks.question: Who typically owns the content created on Aptosphere?
options: The Aptosphere team
The content creator who posted it
The Aptos Foundation
No one owns the content
tasks.correctAnswer: The content creator who posted it

tasks.title: Monetization Features
tasks.question: What monetization features might Aptosphere offer to creators?
options: No monetization is possible
Only advertising revenue
Tips, creator coins, subscriptions, or NFT content
Only traditional off-platform payments
tasks.correctAnswer: Tips, creator coins, subscriptions, or NFT content

tasks.title: Censorship Resistance
tasks.question: How does content moderation typically work in decentralized social platforms like Aptosphere?
options: Complete censorship of any controversial content
No moderation whatsoever
Balance between censorship resistance and community standards through decentralized governance
Only government agencies can moderate content
tasks.correctAnswer: Balance between censorship resistance and community standards through decentralized governance

tasks.title: Cross-Platform Compatibility
tasks.question: How might Aptosphere handle interoperability with other platforms?
options: No interoperability is possible
Only with other Aptos applications
Through open standards and protocols that allow data portability
Only through manual exports and imports
tasks.correctAnswer: Through open standards and protocols that allow data portability

tasks.title: Implementation Technology
tasks.question: How is Aptosphere implemented on the Aptos blockchain?
options: Using Solidity smart contracts
As a centralized service with occasional blockchain integration
Using Move modules on Aptos for on-chain social features
Through a traditional database with blockchain verification
tasks.correctAnswer: Using Move modules on Aptos for on-chain social features
